intro: Polygonum pilatense, commonly known as the Pilatense knotweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive nodes and hollow stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the edges. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom in late summer. Polygonum pilatense is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in temperate to cold climates.
